data.title: Helen Hilary Martin Engaged To Richard Spalding, Student
data.text:
Mr. and Mrs. Francis Augustus Martin Jr. of Hillsborough, Calif., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Helen Hilary Martin, to Richard Coxe Spalding of New York.

Mr. Spalding and his fiancee plan to be married in Hillsborough in the spring.

He is a son of Elizabeth Coxe Spalding of Greenwich, Conn., a member of the Status of Women's Commission for Connecticut, and of Charles F. Spalding of New York, who is a vice president of Lazard Freres, New York investment bankers.

Miss Martin is an official assistant with the southern lending division of Bankers Trust here. Her father is a consultant for Cunningham & Walsh in the San Francisco office of the advertising concern.

Miss Martin's great‚Äêgrandfather, the late M. H. de Young, was founder of The San Francisco Chronicle.

Miss Martin graduated from Miss Porter's School and received a B.A. degree in history in 1972 from Wheaton College in Norton, Mass.

She is a granddaughter of Joseph Oliver Tobin of Hillsborough, retired president of the Hibernia Bank in San Francisco, and the late Mrs. Tobin, and the late Mr. and Mrs. Francis A. Martin of Plainfield, N. J. and New York. Mr. Martin was a New York naval architect.

Mr. Spalding graduated from Phillips Academy in Andover, Mass., and from Harvard College in 1972. He is in his final year at the Columbia .Law School, where he is on The Law Review.

He is a grandson of Mrs. Vaughan C. Spalding of Palm Beach, Fla., and Chicago, and the late Mr. Spalding, a Chicago investment hanker, and the late Mr. and Mrs. Eckley B. Coxe of Philadelphia. Mr. Coxe was a limited partner with Auchincloss, Parker & Redpath, stockbrokers.
